result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:00 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow and Karl Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jordan Donald Anderson in court, Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Jordan Donald Anderson. INCLUDES 22CF363 (Set for MH) and 22TR1599 (STC). Motion regarding Return of Property. Atty. Nero reviews Exhibit #1 (vehicle inventory) received prior to today's hearing. DA Anderson responds, does not object to items 1-8 listed on inventory. Counsel arguments. Atty. Nero requests to continue motion hearing. Court notes some inventory and some documents will be returned. Clerk: Lindabaur at 2:18 PM. All other appearances as previously stated. Court orders miscellaneous paperwork in item 9 be identified within 14 days. DA Anderson to confirm toolbox is in law enforcement possession. Balance of item 9 and item 10 to be addressed at next hearing. Atty Nero to file proposed order. Court will sign after 5 days if no objection. Court expects items to be returned as discussed. Court sets continued MH. DE confirms address. Adjourned at 2:21 PM.  Off record: Exhibit #1; O/R. gll

1:45 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Defendant Jordan Donald Anderson in court, Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Jordan Donald Anderson. INCLUDES 22CF363 (PH) and 22TR1599 (IN). 22TR1599: NG plea entered. 22CF363 WOPH: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ARGN: NG plea entered. Atty. Nero notes motion for return of property. ADA Rockow responds. Atty. Nero requests motion hearing regarding return of property. Court sets MH. Adjourned: 2:50 PM. kma

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan Donald Anderson
Current: 58 4 1/2 Ave, Clayton, WI 54004 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2022)
Prior: 657A 200th Ave, Somerset, WI 54025 
Per DE in writing.  gll

* AMENDED *

- BOND ON FILE. Remaining amount to be refunded to payor. 

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, George R. and Samantha B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   Not to enter any beer tent, distillery, business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF363 (BBH) & 22TR1599 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Adam P Nero and  DF:  Jordan Donald Anderson appear via zoom. Atty Bosworth and her client appear via zoom. Case called at 3:34 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a bail bond hearing. Motions were filed by both parties. Court will focus on bond modification requests first. ADA Rockow requesting language be added to bond. Gives argument. Report was made.  DE does not object to the request. Atty Nero gives argument. Requesting a reduction in cash bail and to remove testing requirement. ADA Rockow objects to request. No reports have been filed by JSC at this time. Rebuttal by Atty Nero. Court reviewed transcript of initial appearance. Will amend bond. DE to report to Clerk of Court Office to sign new bond by end of the week. Preliminary hearing is scheduled. Parties to appear in person. Atty Bosworth and client may appear via zoom. Court adjourned at 4:06 p.m.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF363 & 22TR1599 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Adam P Nero appears via zoom   DF:  Jordan Donald Anderson appeared. Atty Kate Bosworth appears with Victims via zoom. Case called at 11:01 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for preliminary hearing. Atty Nero was just retained and requested prelim to be rescheduled. Waives time limits. Atty Bosworth states she would like to be present with her clients at that hearing. Court schedules. ADA Rockow would like to add a condition to bond. Atty Nero objects. Did not receive notice. Requesting motion should be filed. Court will schedule for a bail bond hearing. Zoom approved for bond hearing. Court directs parties to file motions. Court adjourned at 11:07 a.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pretrial Assessment Report. hml

A lady called to inquire about posting bond & if it would be refunded back. She was advised that typically bond is applied to costs, surcharges, REST, etc first & then any remaining bal would be refunded to the payor, but all decisions re: bond money are ultimately up to the judge. She was also advised that if the $25,000 is posted & bond is reduced, the difference would be refunded if ordered by the judge. jaf
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, George R. and Samantha B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Derek W Sanders for purposes of today only   DF:  Jordan Donald Anderson appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Sanders waives further reading. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. Atty Dippolito requesting speedy preliminary hearing. Court schedules preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
